forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
First try booting using QEMU - install RMPrepUSB and click on QEMU button - does it boot? If so then your BIOS is at fault.  
Next test your USB 16GB drive using RMPrepUSB - Quick Size Test (destroys all data but is quick) - or H2TESTW - which is much slower but doesn't test used portions.  

pls report back here...

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Use Plop!  
Add a menu entry to grub4dos menu.lst to run plopbt.bin. Then use Plop to boot back to the USB drive again. Then choose the menu entry to boot to your linux.  
See [here](https://sites.google.com/a/rmprepusb.com/www/tutorials/plop "External link")for details - there is a section on how to autorun Plop (though Plop does not always work on some systems so I don't recommend that).  

OR make sure the linux files are in the FIRST 8GB of the 16GB USB pen.
